title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Up to 3 points for a reasonable description of each environment, with an appropriate justification.

Descriptions may include:

  • Anacharis is adapted to an environment where transpiration does not occur, such as underwater or in 100 percent humidity. There is no need for water vapor or it cannot occur via transpiration.

  • Water lilies are adapted to an environment where only the upper side of the leaf is exposed to air; thus, only one surface can exchange water vapor with the environment. The large number of stomata is not a disadvantage because the plant has easy access to water.

  • Black walnut is adapted to an environment where the upper surface is exposed to strong sunlight and higher temperatures and/or where water is more limited compared to a watery environment. Stomata located on lower epidermis of leaves are shaded from exposure to direct sunlight and higher temperatures, mitigating excessive water loss.
